bug.author: J-zin
bug.summary: convolution2d_transpose() got an unexpected keyword argument 'kernel_constraint'
bug.description: when i use tensorflow.contrib.layers.convolution2d_transpose() using tensorflow1.13-gpu, ubuntu i got this error: convolution2d_transpose() got an unexpected keyword argument 'kernel_constraint' but i check the document, there exits 'kernel_constraint' parameter in tensorflow.contrib.layers.convolution2d_transpose how to fix it???

comments.comment: If you are looking for docs, then here is the <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.13/api_docs/python/tf>link</denchmark-link> . However, I do recommend you to upgrade to newer version of <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install>Tensorflow</denchmark-link> . I believe that is removed in Tensorflow 2.0 so you should take that in consideration (find alternative). In TF2, there is <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/conv2d_transpose>conv2d_transpose</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/J-zin>@J-zin</denchmark-link> As suggested by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ichisadashioko>@ichisadashioko</denchmark-link> Can you try or and let us know how it progresses. Please also share platform details and also provide a simple standalone code to reproduce the issue. Thanks!
It has been 14 days with no activity and the awaiting response label was assigned. Is this still an issue?
Closing due to lack of recent activity. Please update the issue when new information becomes available, and we will reopen the issue. Thanks!
